moves.1. f4: This is taken from a tournament match. savsams had already easily beaten me on the first game, this one turned out a little more evenly, the computer analysis is available on http://gameknot.com/analyze-board.pl?bd=17128374
moves.2. fxe5 Nc6 3. Nc3 d6 4. Nf3 dxe5 5. e4: Pressuring the bishop but also advancing on the side it looks like white will castle on
moves.11. Bb3 Nd4: Trying to maintain pressure on white and opening c so my pawn can advance
moves.12. Nxd4 Bxd4 13. O-O-O Bd7 14. Ne2 Bb6: I don't like this spot for the bishop but I don't really like c5 any more, at least from here it can support the pawn advance
moves.15. a3 Be6 16. Bxe6 Qxe6: threatening Qa2 which could be uncomfortable for white
moves.17. Kb1 c5: According to the computer this is where I first go astray, it prefers a5
moves.18. Ng3 f6 19. Be3 a5: intending an eventual a4 then b4
According to the computer this is the first mistake of the game, it prefers d4
moves.26... Rxb4 27. Rf2 Nc6: I want the rook on b3 so I can advance the a pawn, to do this I am going to need the knight on d4 to protect the rook
moves.33... Rab8 34. Rxb3 Rxb3 35. Rd2: clearly this is rapidly heading towards an end game so my intention for now was to keep the white king cornered in while I try to bring my king into the action
moves.35... Kf7 36. d4 Re3 37. d5 Rxe4: threatening Rd4 which should let me grab the white d pawn
moves.38. Ka3 Rd4 39. Rxd4 exd4 40. Kxa4 Ke7: preventing the d pawn promoting but not sure I can prevent the b pawn.
moves.41. Kb4 d3 42. Kc3 d2: clearly the pawn is lost so I wanted the black king as far away as possible
moves.43. Kxd2 Kd6 44. Kc3 Kxd5 45. Kb4 h5: Here I was hoping I might be able to delay whites promotion enough to take advantage of my pawn majority on the queens side
At this point the computer has me at +2.87 but from the next move on, it shows us as both at about 0.01. During the game, at this point, I thought I would be able to promote from here but I now think I had miscalculated.
moves.57. Kxb8 Ke4 58. Kc7 h4 59. Kc6:
It was here I realised I had miscalculated and a draw was agreed.

Thanks for reading, please comment
